query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Tal era io in quella turba spessa, 11 volgendo a loro, e qua e là, la faccia, 12 e promettendo mi sciogliea da essa.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Such was I in that thick crowd, 11 turning my face to them, here and there, 12 and promising myself to free myself from it.
**Malay:**
10 Begitulah keadaanku di tengah kerumunan yang padat itu, 11 menoleh ke arah mereka, ke sana ke mari, 12 dan berjanji pada diriku sendiri untuk membebaskan diri darinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Quiv’ era l’Aretin che da le braccia 14 fiere di Ghin di Tacco ebbe la morte, 15 e l’altro ch’annegò correndo in caccia.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Here was the Aretine who from the arms 14 of fierce Ghin di Tacco met his death, 15 and the other who drowned while running in the hunt.
**Malay:**
13 Di sinilah orang Aretine yang dari pelukan 14 Ghin di Tacco yang ganas menemui ajalnya, 15 dan yang lainnya yang tenggelam saat berlari dalam perburuan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Quivi pregava con le mani sporte 17 Federigo Novello, e quel da Pisa 18 che fé parer lo buon Marzucco forte.
query.result:
**English:**
16 There Frederick Novello prayed with outstretched hands, 17 and he of Pisa who made the good Marzucco seem strong.
**Malay:**
16 Di sana Frederick Novello berdoa dengan tangan terentang, 17 dan dia dari Pisa yang membuat Marzucco yang baik tampak kuat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Come libero fui da tutte quante 26 quell’ ombre che pregar pur ch’altri prieghi, 27 sì che s’avacci lor divenir sante,
28 io cominciai: «El par che tu mi nieghi, 29 o luce mia, espresso in alcun testo 30 che decreto del cielo orazion pieghi;
31 e questa gente prega pur di questo: 32 sarebbe dunque loro speme vana, 33 o non m’è ’l detto tuo ben manifesto?».
query.result:
**English:**
25 As soon as I was free from all those 26 shades who prayed only that others pray, 27 so that they may hasten to become saints,
28 I began: "It seems that you deny me, 29 O my light, as is expressed in some text, 30 that a decree of heaven can be swayed by pious prayers;
31 and these people pray only for this: 32 would their hope then be in vain, 33 or is your saying not clear to me?"
**Malay:**
25 Begitu aku bebas dari semua 26 bayangan yang berdoa hanya agar orang lain berdoa, 27 sehingga mereka dapat segera menjadi orang suci,
28 aku mulai berkata: "Tampaknya engkau menolakku, 29 O cahayaku, sebagaimana dinyatakan dalam beberapa teks, 30 bahwa keputusan surga dapat diubah oleh doa-doa yang saleh;
31 dan orang-orang ini hanya berdoa untuk ini: 32 apakah harapan mereka akan sia-sia, 33 atau apakah ucapanmu tidak jelas bagiku?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Veramente a così alto sospetto 44 non ti fermar, se quella nol ti dice 45 che lume fia tra ’l vero e lo ’ntelletto.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Truly, do not stop at such high suspicion, 44 if she does not tell you 45 that she will be a light between the truth and the intellect.
**Malay:**
43 Sungguh, jangan berhenti pada kecurigaan yang begitu tinggi, 44 jika dia tidak memberitahumu 45 bahwa dia akan menjadi cahaya antara kebenaran dan intelek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Non so se ’ntendi: io dico di Beatrice; 47 tu la vedrai di sopra, in su la vetta 48 di questo monte, ridere e felice».
query.result:
**English:**
46 I don't know if you understand: I speak of Beatrice; 47 you will see her above, on the summit 48 of this mountain, laughing and happy."
**Malay:**
46 Aku tidak tahu apakah kamu mengerti: aku berbicara tentang Beatrice; 47 kamu akan melihatnya di atas, di puncak 48 gunung ini, tertawa dan bahagia."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 E io: «Segnore, andiamo a maggior fretta, 50 ché già non m’affatico come dianzi, 51 e vedi omai che ’l poggio l’ombra getta».
query.result:
**English:**
49 And I: "Sir, let us go with greater haste, 50 for I am not as weary as I was before, 51 and you see that the hill is already casting its shadow."
**Malay:**
49 Dan aku: "Tuan, mari kita pergi dengan lebih cepat, 50 karena aku sudah tidak selelah sebelumnya, 51 dan kamu lihat bahwa bukit itu sudah menjatuhkan bayangannya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 «Noi anderem con questo giorno innanzi», 53 rispuose, «quanto più potremo omai; 54 ma ’l fatto è d’altra forma che non stanzi.
query.result:
**English:**
52 "We shall go forward with this day ahead of us," 53 he replied, "as much as we can now; 54 but the fact is different from what you think.
**Malay:**
52 "Kita akan terus maju dengan hari ini di hadapan kita," 53 jawabnya, "sebanyak yang kita mampu sekarang; 54 tetapi faktanya berbeda dari apa yang kamu pikirkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 Prima che sie là sù, tornar vedrai 56 colui che già si cuopre de la costa, 57 sì che ’ suoi raggi tu romper non fai.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Before he is up there, you will see returning 56 the one who is already covering himself with the hillside, 57 so that you do not break his rays.
**Malay:**
55 Sebelum dia berada di sana, kamu akan melihat kembali 56 dia yang sudah menutupi dirinya dengan lereng bukit, 57 sehingga kamu tidak menghalangi sinarnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Ma vedi là un’anima che, posta 59 sola soletta, inverso noi riguarda: 60 quella ne ’nsegnerà la via più tosta».
query.result:
**English:**
58 But see there a soul who, placed 59 alone all alone, looks toward us: 60 she will teach us the harder way.
**Malay:**
58 Tetapi lihatlah di sana ada jiwa yang, ditempatkan 59 sendirian, menatap ke arah kita: 60 dia akan mengajarkan kita jalan yang lebih sulit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Venimmo a lei: o anima lombarda, 62 come ti stavi altera e disdegnosa 63 e nel mover de li occhi onesta e tarda!
64 Ella non ci dicëa alcuna cosa, 65 ma lasciavane gir, solo sguardando 66 a guisa di leon quando si posa.
query.result:
**English:**
61 We came to her: oh Lombard soul, 62 how proud and disdainful you stood 63 and in the movement of your eyes, honest and slow!
64 She did not say anything to us, 65 but let us go, only looking 66 like a lion when it rests.
**Malay:**
61 Kami datang kepadanya: oh jiwa Lombardia, 62 betapa sombong dan angkuhnya dirimu berdiri 63 dan dalam gerakan matamu, jujur dan lambat!
64 Dia tidak mengatakan apa pun kepada kami, 65 tetapi membiarkan kami pergi, hanya menatap 66 seperti singa ketika sedang beristirahat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Pur Virgilio si trasse a lei, pregando 68 che ne mostrasse la miglior salita; 69 e quella non rispuose al suo dimando,
70 ma di nostro paese e de la vita 71 ci ’nchiese; e ’l dolce duca incominciava 72 «Mantüa . . . », e l’ombra, tutta in sé romita,
73 surse ver’ lui del loco ove pria stava, 74 dicendo: «O Mantoano, io son Sordello 75 de la tua terra!»; e l’un l’altro abbracciava.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Although Virgil approached her, pleading 68 that she show us the best way up, 69 and she did not respond to his request,
70 but asked us about our country and our lives; 71 and the gentle leader began, 72 "Mantua . . . ", and the shade, all reserved within itself,
73 rose towards him from the place where it had been standing, 74 saying: "O Mantuan, I am Sordello 75 from your land!"; and they embraced each other.
**Malay:**
67 Meskipun Virgil mendekatinya, memohon 68 agar dia menunjukkan jalan terbaik untuk naik, 69 dan dia tidak menanggapi permintaannya,
70 tetapi bertanya kepada kami tentang negara dan kehidupan kami; 71 dan pemimpin yang lembut itu memulai, 72 "Mantua . . . ", dan bayangan itu, yang sangat pendiam,
73 bangkit ke arahnya dari tempat dia berdiri, 74 berkata: "Hai orang Mantua, aku Sordello 75 dari negerimu!"; dan mereka saling berpelukan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Ahi serva Italia, di dolore ostello, 77 nave sanza nocchiere in gran tempesta, 78 non donna di province, ma bordello!
79 Quell’ anima gentil fu così presta, 80 sol per lo dolce suon de la sua terra, 81 di fare al cittadin suo quivi festa;
82 e ora in te non stanno sanza guerra 83 li vivi tuoi, e l’un l’altro si rode 84 di quei ch’un muro e una fossa serra.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Alas, Italy, hostel of grief, 77 ship without a helmsman in a great tempest, 78 not lady of provinces, but a brothel!
79 That gentle soul was so eager, 80 just for the sweet sound of his native land, 81 to celebrate his fellow citizen here;
82 and now in you your living inhabitants are not without war, 83 and they gnaw at each other, 84 those whom one wall and one moat enclose.
**Malay:**
76 Ah, Italia yang malang, penginapan kesedihan, 77 kapal tanpa nakhoda dalam badai besar, 78 bukan wanita provinsi, tapi rumah bordil!
79 Jiwa yang lembut itu begitu bersemangat, 80 hanya karena suara manis tanah kelahirannya, 81 untuk merayakan sesama warganya di sini;
82 dan sekarang di dalam dirimu pendudukmu yang masih hidup tidak tanpa perang, 83 dan mereka saling menggerogoti, 84 mereka yang dikelilingi oleh satu tembok dan satu parit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Cerca, misera, intorno da le prode 86 le tue marine, e poi ti guarda in seno, 87 s’alcuna parte in te di pace gode.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Look, wretched one, around the shores 86 of your seas, and then look within yourself, 87 if any part of you enjoys peace.
**Malay:**
85 Lihatlah, hai yang malang, di sekitar pantai 86 lautanmu, dan kemudian lihatlah ke dalam dirimu, 87 jika ada bagian dirimu yang menikmati kedamaian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Che val perché ti racconciasse il freno 89 Iustinïano, se la sella è vòta? 90 Sanz’ esso fora la vergogna meno.
query.result:
**English:**
88 What use is it to you that Justinian puts the bridle on you, 89 if the saddle is empty? 90 Without it, the shame would be less.
**Malay:**
88 Apakah gunanya bagimu jika Justinian memakaikanmu kekang, 89 jika pelana itu kosong? 90 Tanpa itu, rasa malunya akan lebih sedikit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Ahi gente che dovresti esser devota, 92 e lasciar seder Cesare in la sella, 93 se bene intendi ciò che Dio ti nota,
94 guarda come esta fiera è fatta fella 95 per non esser corretta da li sproni, 96 poi che ponesti mano a la predella.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Ah, people who should be devout, 92 and let Caesar sit in the saddle, 93 if you understand well what God notes for you,
94 look how this beast has become wicked 95 for not being corrected by the spurs, 96 since you put your hand on the bridle.
**Malay:**
91 Ah, hai orang-orang yang seharusnya berbakti, 92 dan biarkan Caesar duduk di pelana, 93 jika kamu mengerti dengan baik apa yang Tuhan catat untukmu,
94 lihatlah bagaimana binatang buas ini menjadi jahat 95 karena tidak dikoreksi oleh taji, 96 sejak kamu meletakkan tanganmu di kekang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 O Alberto tedesco ch’abbandoni 98 costei ch’è fatta indomita e selvaggia, 99 e dovresti inforcar li suoi arcioni,
100 giusto giudicio da le stelle caggia 101 sovra ’l tuo sangue, e sia novo e aperto, 102 tal che ’l tuo successor temenza n’aggia!
103 Ch’avete tu e ’l tuo padre sofferto, 104 per cupidigia di costà distretti, 105 che ’l giardin de lo ’mperio sia diserto.
query.result:
**English:**
97 O German Albert who abandon 98 this one who is made untamed and wild, 99 and you should mount her saddle,
100 may just judgment fall from the stars 101 upon your blood, and may it be new and open, 102 such that your successor may fear it!
103 What have you and your father suffered, 104 through greed for these districts, 105 that the garden of the empire is deserted?
**Malay:**
97 Wahai Albert dari Jerman yang meninggalkan 98 wanita ini yang telah menjadi liar dan tak terjinakkan, 99 dan engkau seharusnya menunggangi pelananya,
100 semoga penghakiman yang adil jatuh dari bintang-bintang 101 ke atas darahmu, dan semoga itu baru dan terbuka, 102 sehingga penggantimu akan takut padanya!
103 Apa yang telah engkau dan ayahmu derita, 104 karena keserakahan terhadap distrik-distrik ini, 105 sehingga taman kekaisaran menjadi sunyi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Vieni a veder Montecchi e Cappelletti, 107 Monaldi e Filippeschi, uom sanza cura: 108 color già tristi, e questi con sospetti!
109 Vien, crudel, vieni, e vedi la pressura 110 d’i tuoi gentili, e cura lor magagne; 111 e vedrai Santafior com’ è oscura!
112 Vieni a veder la tua Roma che piagne 113 vedova e sola, e dì e notte chiama: 114 «Cesare mio, perché non m’accompagne?».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Come and see the Montagues and Capulets, 107 the Monaldi and Filippeschi, men without care: 108 those already sad, and these suspicious!
109 Come, cruel one, come and see the oppression 110 of your people, and heal their suffering; 111 and you will see how dark Santafior is!
112 Come and see your Rome that weeps, 113 widowed and alone, and calls out day and night: 114 "My Caesar, why do you not accompany me?".
**Malay:**
106 Datanglah untuk melihat keluarga Montague dan Capulet, 107 keluarga Monaldi dan Filippeschi, orang-orang yang tidak peduli: 108 mereka yang sudah sedih, dan mereka yang curiga!
109 Datanglah, kejam, datanglah dan lihat penindasan 110 terhadap rakyatmu, dan sembuhkan penderitaan mereka; 111 dan kamu akan melihat betapa gelapnya Santafior!
112 Datanglah untuk melihat Romamu yang menangis, 113 janda dan sendirian, dan memanggil siang dan malam: 114 "Caesar-ku, mengapa kamu tidak menemaniku?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Vieni a veder la gente quanto s’ama! 116 e se nulla di noi pietà ti move, 117 a vergognar ti vien de la tua fama.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Come and see how much people love each other! 116 And if no pity for us moves you, 117 come to be ashamed of your fame.
**Malay:**
115 Datanglah untuk melihat betapa orang-orang saling mencintai! 116 Dan jika tidak ada belas kasihan untuk kami yang menggerakkanmu, 117 datanglah untuk merasa malu dengan ketenaranmu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 E se licito m’è, o sommo Giove 119 che fosti in terra per noi crucifisso, 120 son li giusti occhi tuoi rivolti altrove?
121 O è preparazion che ne l’abisso 122 del tuo consiglio fai per alcun bene 123 in tutto de l’accorger nostro scisso?
124 Ché le città d’Italia tutte piene 125 son di tiranni, e un Marcel diventa 126 ogne villan che parteggiando viene.
query.result:
**English:**
118 And if it is permissible for me, O supreme Jove, 119 who were crucified on earth for us, 120 are your just eyes turned elsewhere?
121 Or is it a preparation that you make in the abyss 122 of your counsel for some good 123 that is completely hidden from our understanding?
124 For all the cities of Italy are full 125 of tyrants, and every peasant who joins a faction 126 becomes a little Caesar.
**Malay:**
118 Dan jika diizinkan bagiku, wahai Jove yang agung, 119 yang telah disalibkan di bumi untuk kami, 120 apakah mata-mata adilmu tertuju ke tempat lain?
121 Atau apakah itu persiapan yang kau buat di jurang 122 nasihatmu untuk kebaikan tertentu 123 yang sepenuhnya tersembunyi dari pemahaman kita?
124 Karena semua kota di Italia penuh 125 dengan para tiran, dan setiap petani yang bergabung dengan faksi 126 menjadi Kaisar kecil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Fiorenza mia, ben puoi esser contenta 128 di questa digression che non ti tocca, 129 mercé del popol tuo che si argomenta.
query.result:
**English:**
127 My Florence, you can be well content 128 with this digression that does not touch you, 129 thanks to your people who are striving.
**Malay:**
127 Florence-ku, engkau boleh berpuas hati 128 dengan penyimpangan ini yang tidak menyentuhmu, 129 berkat rakyatmu yang sedang berusaha keras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Molti han giustizia in cuore, e tardi scocca 131 per non venir sanza consiglio a l’arco; 132 ma il popol tuo l’ha in sommo de la bocca.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Many have justice in their hearts, and the arrow is released late 131 so as not to come to the bow without counsel; 132 but your people have it on the tip of their tongues.
**Malay:**
130 Banyak yang memiliki keadilan di dalam hati mereka, dan anak panah dilepaskan terlambat 131 agar tidak datang ke busur tanpa nasihat; 132 tetapi umatmu mengucapkannya di ujung lidah mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Molti rifiutan lo comune incarco; 134 ma il popol tuo solicito risponde 135 sanza chiamare, e grida: «I’ mi sobbarco!».
query.result:
**English:**
133 Many refuse the common burden; 134 but your people, eager, respond 135 without being called, and cry: "I take it upon myself!"
**Malay:**
133 Banyak yang menolak beban bersama; 134 tetapi rakyatmu yang bersemangat menjawab 135 tanpa dipanggil, dan berseru: "Aku memikulnya!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Or ti fa lieta, ché tu hai ben onde: 137 tu ricca, tu con pace e tu con senno! 138 S’io dico ’l ver, l’effetto nol nasconde.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Now it makes you glad, for you have good reason: 137 you are wealthy, you have peace, and you have wisdom! 138 If I speak the truth, the effect does not hide it.
**Malay:**
136 Sekarang itu membuatmu senang, karena kamu punya alasan yang bagus: 137 kamu kaya, kamu dengan kedamaian dan kamu dengan akal sehat! 138 Jika aku mengatakan yang sebenarnya, efeknya tidak menyembunyikannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Atene e Lacedemona, che fenno 140 l’antiche leggi e furon sì civili, 141 fecero al viver bene un picciol cenno
142 verso di te, che fai tanto sottili 143 provedimenti, ch’a mezzo novembre 144 non giugne quel che tu d’ottobre fili.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Athens and Lacedaemon, which made 140 the ancient laws and were so civilized, 141 made a small gesture towards living well
142 compared to you, who make such subtle 143 provisions that what you spin in October 144 does not last until mid-November.
**Malay:**
139 Athens dan Lacedaemon, yang membuat 140 undang-undang kuno dan sangat beradab, 141 membuat isyarat kecil untuk hidup dengan baik
142 dibandingkan denganmu, yang membuat ketentuan yang sangat halus 143 sehingga apa yang kamu hasilkan pada bulan Oktober 144 tidak bertahan sampai pertengahan November.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
145 Quante volte, del tempo che rimembre, 146 legge, moneta, officio e costume 147 hai tu mutato, e rinovate membre!
148 E se ben ti ricordi e vedi lume, 149 vedrai te somigliante a quella inferma 150 che non può trovar posa in su le piume,
151 ma con dar volta suo dolore scherma.
query.result:
**English:**
145 How many times, since the time that I can remember, 146 have you changed laws, currency, officials, and customs, 147 and renewed your members!
148 And if you remember well and see clearly, 149 you will see yourself resembling that sick woman 150 who cannot find rest on her bed,
151 but tries to alleviate her pain by tossing and turning.
**Malay:**
145 Betapa banyak kali, sejak masa yang kuingat, 146 undang-undang, mata uang, pejabat, dan adat istiadat 147 telah kau ubah, dan memperbarui anggota-anggotamu!
148 Dan jika kau mengingat dengan baik dan melihat dengan jelas, 149 kau akan melihat dirimu menyerupai wanita sakit itu 150 yang tidak dapat menemukan ketenangan di atas tempat tidurnya,
151 tetapi dengan membolak-balikkan tubuhnya, ia mencoba meringankan rasa sakitnya.
